attributes.action: Mail an unbiased summary of EU pros & cons to UK residents before the referendum
attributes.additional_details: A large proportion of the UK population will enter the referendum vote without a strong understanding of the EU and the UK's relationship with it. If the UK government thinks the general population are best placed to make such a crucial decision, it should do all it can to help those people understand the pros and cons of EU membership with an easily understandable, independent overview; but without spin, bias or agenda. This should be provided by mail to every household to maximise coverage.
attributes.background: It is unfair to ask the general population to make such an important decision on the future of the country without arming them with a basic understanding of what they are being asked to vote on.
